text: <@U105Y4SDC>: magic :P
<@U11Q8S66T|shelajev> has joined the channel

Hey all. I’m having a problem with FragmentStatePageAdapter. I have a fragment with the adapter and adding fragments works, but the fragments in the tabs are mixed up. It’s always loading the first two fragments at the same time and clicking on a tab loads the wrong fragment with a the following error: "W/FragmentManager: moveToState: Fragment state for OutfitListFragment{5dfea1b #2 id=0x7f0e0131} not updated inline; expected state 3 found 2”. Searched for a solution but could not find anything useful/working.
I have the same problem, it’s seem to be a warning.
Might be only a warning, but the fragments are completely messed up

I have a network call in all the fragments in that adapter and when the parent fragment is loaded and the fragments are being added to the adapter, the first two fragments are making a call, not just the first one
Plus the second fragment is on the first tab and so on… the last one being empty
I wouldn’t mind if it’s just a warning, but it’s totally messed up

>It’s always loading the first two fragments
This is normal, it always loads the first couple of pages
<@U0D0AFX1B>: Could you post the code that how you add your fragment to adapter and the network call.
I’m having a meeting in a couple of minutes. Will do afterwards!
Have you try to add log to check if the fragment calls the correct network call?
you can always check which tab is selected on resume and if its the same tab as fragment suppose to be then only make all those calls..
It’s just that the second fragment i add automatically gets created when starting the parent fragment
otherwise without any condition the next two fragment bydefault will load as you move to another tab
Which would not be that much of a problem. The problem is just that if i click on tab3 i see the fragment which belongs in tab2 and so on
I had similar issue for that what i did was I created the view but not loaded the data until user actually looking at the fragment
Gonna post some code after the meeting.
yeah sure.
OK.
<https://gist.github.com/anstaendig/f50c42a82f3d990e779e4e5606f50d0d>
<https://gist.github.com/anstaendig/2d7769172a7bbc4c80613cd682fcb23b>
Those are the two files that are important i guess
<@U0XCFE6AH>: <@U04UCB0RU>
use this function in your fragment

and use your        loadOutfits();
function if (isVisibleToUser)
so im calling loadOutfits in setUserVisibleHint() in if (isVisibleToUser) ?
yup
try this
or simply do this
The first solution does not do the trick

04-19 11:29:53.839 452-452/com.app.amaze.amazeapp D/OutfitListFragment: onResume: Type: DRAFT
04-19 11:29:53.840 452-452/com.app.amaze.amazeapp D/OutfitListFragment: onResume: Type: READY
This happens when the parent fragment starts
use this in the child fragment which you dont want to load until it been visible
And clicking on the 2nd tab actually loads the third
I did, but let’s try with your second solution
oh no wait
i messed something up, wait :smile:
FragmentManager: moveToState: Fragment state for OutfitListFragment{f8e7bfb #2 id=0x7f0e0131} not updated inline; expected state 3 found 2
Still messed up, fragment3 is in tab2
Oh boi, this i driving me nuts
No wait
niks, the second one did the trick i guess
Thankyou I guess...
thanks man
